TITLE: Using the API via curl
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to use curl to retrieve weather data from the API for a specific city. Replace {city} with the desired city name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/robertoduessmann/weather-api/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl http://localhost:3000/weather/{city}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example API Response
DESCRIPTION: This JSON represents the expected response format from the Weather API. It includes temperature, wind speed, a description, and a two-day forecast.
SOURCE: https://github.com/robertoduessmann/weather-api/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "temperature": "29 °C",
  "wind": "20 km/h",
  "description": "Partly cloudy",
  "forecast": [
    {
      "day": 1,
      "temperature": "27 °C",
      "wind": "12 km/h"
    },
    {
      "day": 2,
      "temperature": "22 °C",
      "wind": "8 km/h"
    }
  ]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example API Request using curl
DESCRIPTION: This command shows a specific example of using curl to request weather data for the city of Curitiba. It assumes the API is running locally on port 3000.
SOURCE: https://github.com/robertoduessmann/weather-api/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
curl http://localhost:3000/weather/Curitiba
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the weather API
DESCRIPTION: This command executes the built weather-api executable, starting the API server. It assumes the weather-api executable is in the current directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/robertoduessmann/weather-api/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
./weather-api
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building the application locally
DESCRIPTION: This command builds the weather-api executable. It requires Go to be installed and configured on the local machine.
SOURCE: https://github.com/robertoduessmann/weather-api/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
go build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install Dependencies using dep ensure
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the project's dependencies using the `dep` tool. It is a prerequisite for running the project and its tests. Make sure `dep` is installed on your system before running this command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/robertoduessmann/weather-api/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
dep ensure
```
